sub_topic: Identifying the automorphism group of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph given below:

```
A --- B
|     |
C --- D
```

What is the automorphism group of this graph?
message_2:
The automorphism group of a graph is the set of all graph automorphisms (i.e., isomorphisms from the graph to itself). In this case, we have a simple square graph with vertices A, B, C, and D.

There are 8 automorphisms for this graph:

1. Identity (no change): A -> A, B -> B, C -> C, D -> D
2. Horizontal reflection: A -> B, B -> A, C -> D, D -> C
3. Vertical reflection: A -> C, B -> D, C -> A, D -> B
4. Diagonal reflection (A-D): A -> D, B -> C, C -> B, D -> A
5. Diagonal reflection (B-C): A -> C, B -> B, C -> A, D -> D
6. 90-degree rotation clockwise: A -> B, B -> D, C -> A, D -> C
7. 90-degree rotation counterclockwise: A -> C, B -> A, C -> D, D -> B
8. 180-degree rotation: A -> D, B -> C, C -> B, D -> A

These 8 automorphisms form the automorphism group of the given graph, which is isomorphic to the Dihedral group of order 8, denoted as D4.
